a.title: Operation Food Search for Food and Family Resources

div.a: Operation Food Search for Food and Family Resources

nav.div: De Soto Public School District #73 » News » What's New » Communication on Coronavirus (COVID-19)

img.br:
The Jefferson County Health Department (JCHD) strongly encourages that if you do not need immediate medical attention, to call your healthcare provider to assess your condition prior to visiting a medical facility to prevent unintended exposure to medical staff.
The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (MO DHSS) has opened a statewide public hotline for individuals needing guidance regarding COVID-19. The hotline is operated by medical professionals and is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
Missouri State COVID-19 Hotline 1-877-435-8411
How can you help prevent the spread of the virus? The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends daily preventive actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory diseases, including:
Wash your hands often with soap and water, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.
Cough or sneeze into the crook of the elbow or into a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect high-touch surfaces and objects.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
CDC does not recommend that people who are healthy wear a facemask to protect themselves from respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. Facemasks should be used by people who show symptoms of COVID-19 to help prevent the spread of the disease to others.
For more information and the latest updates on the coronavirus, please see the following websites:
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
World Health Organization
Missouri DHSS - Missouri Department of Health & Senior Services
Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Fact Sheet from Missouri DHSS
Jefferson County Health Department
April 17, 2020
Included in this letter are quick updates on a few currently relevant items, including final grades, virtual summer school, and the final run of instructional resources. Also available is information for food and basic needs assistance if you have any need or know of anyone in need.
Operation Food Search Resource Finder
April 9, 2020
Please see the following letter regarding closure through the end of the 2020 school year. We will continue to communicate each decision as soon as we are able to do so effectively.
April 8, 2020
Meal Service Update Starting Monday, April 13, 2020.
Next week we will be providing two meals a day for all seven days of the week by distributing multiple meals on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Please see our meal service page on the left-hand menu for the updated information.
April 6, 2020
COVID-19 Closure Classroom Resources Round II, with updated instructional resources, has been added to our district website, as well as in the family guidelines which was also mailed to every district family on Thursday, April 2.
Families: Start Here_Extended Closure Information
March 23, 2020
To remain consistent with the Jefferson County Stay At Home Orders, guidance from local health and government officials, and in the best interest of the health and safety of our students, staff, and communities, De Soto School District will remain closed through Friday, April 24, 2020. The earliest school will resume is Monday, April 27, 2020. The reopening date is subject to change pending further information. Please read the included letter for more information and do not hesitate to reach out if we can be of assistance in any way.
In order to deliver materials appropriately to your student, based on your family’s accessibility, we ask that each family complete this form to indicate how easily online materials can be accessed while at home.
De Soto #73 Access Survey
March 17, 2020
On Monday, a scheduled PD day for our district, staff gathered resources to send home with our students to help them keep previously learned classroom material fresh and to use this time to revisit this past learning and practice skills. Paper copies were sent home with our students today, Tuesday, March 17, 2020 and electronic copies may also be found below.
COVID-19 Closure Classroom Resources Round I - March 7 - April 6, 2020
​
March 16, 2020
Many of our students rely on meal service during the school day; therefore, we will continue to provide meals to students as needed during our closure. Further information for accessing these meals is included in this flyer.
March 15, 2020
See the following letter containing important information regarding school closure due to COVID-19. Safety is always our first priority. Thank you for your partnership in this challenging time.
March 14, 2020
Please see the following communication from the district regarding family guidance for COVID-19.
February 28, 2020
Please see the following letter regarding district preparations for the possibility of the spread of the Coronavirus.
